storyInfo: Aciddrop, after finishing her field operation, is relaxing in a Columbian city. Due to the publicity efforts of an off-duty police officer, she somehow finds herself in the middle of a graffiti art competition.

attributes.content: Hey, you. Yes, you.
There's no one else here.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I know.
Are you the one who tagged the wall out there, along main street?
You're trying to get away on skateboard?!
Hold up—You've got the wrong idea! I'm not a cop!
What do you want, then?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I just wanted to ask, do you want to join a graffiti art competition?
Haha, very funny. You expect me to believe the city's encouraging vandalism now?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Here, check this out.
A pamphlet?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: If you're worried about me grabbing you, I'll just leave it over here. You come get it yourself, alright?
City... street culture... festival? Graffiti contest, skateboard racing, parkour expo, rap battles... and a huge prize pool? And they're gonna broadcast it live?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Did everyone on the city council's brains collectively short-circuit or what?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Don't ask me, they just hired me to do publicity.
Yeah right.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: What kinda hired errand boy chases people down alleys, shouting 'hey, you, yes, you' at them?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Just a habit from my other line of work.
So you are a cop.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Off duty. For now, I'm just passing out flyers for some extra cash.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: If you're interested, take it and sign up. When you register, be sure to get them to write down the number here, and that'll give you access to free mineral water through the whole competition.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: And that's how you get your cut?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: ...Listen, girl. You don't like getting questioned? Well, neither do cops, off duty or otherwise.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: If you're not interested, then scram. I don't have time for your little detective game. If I didn't need the money, you can bet I'd be giving you an earful for the vandalism.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: (Pats the police officer's shoulder)
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: My bad, I should've known not to pry.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: So, I just sign up at this place here, and hand them the flyer?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: (Nods hesitantly)
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: Are they still open?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: You're all set, Miss Aciddrop. Do you have any other questions?
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Whose idea was it to hold a competition like this anyway?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Representative Cooper of the City Council wants everyone to gain a deeper understanding of our young folks and their street culture.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: At the same time, it's also a way of encouraging the youth to participate in the construction and maintenance of the city.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Gotcha. So it was this Cooper guy's idea, right?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: More or less.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: So is there anything else? If not, you're holding up the line...
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Oh, one last thing.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: The guy who gave me the flyer said he'd get paid if I signed up with this number.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: That's right. As long as you show up to the preliminaries tomorrow, we'll send the money to his account the next day. If you make it to the finals or even place, he'll get an even bigger bonus.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Are you also interested in helping promote the competition?
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Just curious.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: That's fine. You can see here how much we pay.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: ...They're throwing around this kinda money just to sign people up? This Cooper guy must have mad cash.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: (Smiles)
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: That's time! Now, we'll have Mr. Cooper and the judges evaluate the pieces from this group of contestants!
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: The contestants are free to move about the venue until evaluations are finished!
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Contestant

attributes.content: ...Who, me?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Who else? I'm Alba, what's your name?
attributes.name: Contestant

attributes.content: Just call me Aciddrop.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Not from around here, huh? Did you join for kicks while on a business trip or something? ...And why do I get the feeling you're just gonna take home the whole thing?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Hey now, don't sell yourself short. I like what you've done with that, uh...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Ink.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Yeah, the way you used ink for the whole black and white look is pretty sweet.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: My grandfather was Yanese. He used to dabble in some Yan-style painting, and even taught me a little when I was young. I got bored of it after half a month, though.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: But I went to study under him again for the past three months, just for this competition.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: All that, just for today?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: All that, just for today.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Rad.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Please stop, you two. You're about to enter the parkour expo area.
attributes.name: Security Officer

attributes.content: My bad, my bad. Mind if we take a peek? We'll just stand over here.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: As long as you don't trespass into the venue itself, that's fine.
attributes.name: Security Officer

attributes.content: That the parkour guy over there?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Must be. Looks damn impressive too—
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: A backflip? Is this gymnastics now?!
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: C'mon, dude! You got this!
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: But... ain't he just a regular old gymnast?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: He's pulling off all these fancy flips and somersaults, but his drops and rolls need some work...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Is that important?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: 'Course it is.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: He's gonna wreck his knees if he keeps landing like that.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Huh... I still don't quite get it.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Contestant Grayson's final time was three minutes and seventeen seconds, a new record for this competition!
attributes.name: Announcement

attributes.content: After retiring from the gymnastics team, Mr. Grayson became the founder of this city's Parkour Association. Let's all put our hands together for his outstanding performance. At the same time, we also welcome all young folks to join the association!
attributes.name: Announcement

attributes.content: (Whispers) An association? Since when was parkour a career?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Do you think that Grayson guy cheated?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Nah, he won fair and square.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: But something about it's just... not cool.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Anyway, let's head back and take a look around.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: ...Skateboarding contestant... seventh place finish... Skateboarding Association opens every Saturday afternoon...
attributes.name: Announcement

attributes.content: ...Prize... advanced division... breakdance scoring procedure... a more formal competition format, with more rigorous standards...
attributes.name: Announcement

attributes.content: I think I see what you were getting at now, Aciddrop.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: There's something wrong with this whole so-called street culture festival.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: They keep going on and on about these associations—
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: ...Alba...
attributes.name: Announcement

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: ...Aciddrop...
attributes.name: Announcement

attributes.content: ...are the contestants who will be moving on to the next round. Please return to the graffiti art competition venue for the explanation of the next round...
attributes.name: Announcement

attributes.content: (Whispers) Representative Cooper, the finalists are here.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: (Clears throat)
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: To all our dear finalists, I am the organizer of this competition, Cooper.
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: We put this event together rather hastily, so we would like to apologize in advance for any less-than-satisfactory experiences you may have during the competition.
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: Hastily? Haven't you been publicizing it for months?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: About that... Indeed, my inexperience as an organizer seems to have brought many of you a subpar experience, for which I apologize.
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: The reason I gathered everyone here is to make an announcement, and express my apologies through my actions—
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: We will hold tomorrow's graffiti art competition on one of City Hall's walls!
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: This spark an uproar.
You serious? You're not just messing with us?
attributes.name: Impatient Contestant

attributes.content: You want us to tag the outside of City Hall? You can't take it back, you said it yourself, dude!
attributes.name: Showy Contestant

attributes.content: Please, quiet down, everyone!
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: I put an application in with the City Council through a special high-priority procedure. Please calm down and listen to me!
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: I've had to endure a lot of pressure to make this competition possible. I hope everyone will cherish—
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: (Scans the crowd)
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: I hope everyone will put their most creative ideas on display in the finals tomorrow.
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: That is all.
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: Next, I will have the staff inform you of the time and place for the start of the competition.
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: The outside of City Hall, huh? Cooper's sure getting his money's worth.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: What, is there something special about that?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Not especially, but those pristine white walls are simply begging to be tagged. The cops used to nab people there just about every night.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Just begging to be tagged, huh...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: That look in your eyes... Don't tell me the tagged wall they found you near was actually City Hall?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Eh, what can I say? It really is a nice wall.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: The tug-o-war between cops and graffiti artists around those walls has been going on for over a year. They've had to scrape and repaint it who knows how many times.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Letting people tag those walls is practically a slap in the face to City Hall and the police. I don't know how Cooper managed to persuade them, but it sure smells like conspiracy to me.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Guess we'll find out tomorrow.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: You're going?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: You aren't?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Whatever this Cooper guy has in mind, as long as the finals aren't cancelled, we'll have the legal right to tag whatever we want, however we want, and nobody has any business getting in our way.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I really wanna see what you can do with that ink of yours. I bet it'll be even cooler than what you did today.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Well, when you put it like that, how can I say no?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: I'd better see your magnum opus tomorrow then too.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Who's there?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Miss Aciddrop, I'm one of the staff from the street culture festival.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: I'm already in bed. Save it for tomorrow.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: This is extremely important, so could you please open the door?
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Thank you very much, Miss.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: So what's the deal?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: We've unanimously agreed that you're the strongest contestant in the graffiti art competition...
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: No need to butter me up. I know exactly what I'm worth.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I'll cut to the chase then. Just give me a nod, and we'll make sure you're crowned winner.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Just a nod? That easy?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Hear me out first. The champion not only earns more prize money, but also gets to automatically become the first president of the city's Graffiti Art Association—
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Perfect, I've been wondering about that. So, what exactly are all these associations, and what are they for?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Naturally, to bring street culture to more people, have more youth participate, and have older folks gain a greater appreciation for it as well.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Take the graffiti art you love so much. After the association is established, it will become a legal government entity, and its members will be protected under the law to freely express their ideas in a reasonable manner.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Even if that expression takes place on someone else's property?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: The association will have a designated venue for its activities.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Okay, say I'm falsely accused of shoplifting by some store, and their surveillance cameras just happened to be down...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: That has nothing to do with what we're talking about—
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: ...I can only spray what was meant for the wall of that shop in that 'designated venue,' right?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Sounds like I hit the nail on the head.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: So I can only express my anger 'in a reasonable manner' in that 'clean and tidy' 'designated venue' that even the shop owner would feel dirty stepping in.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Once it is formed, the first legal venue for the association will be the white walls of City Hall. There's no way your hypothetical shopkeeper would miss it.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: ...Is that so?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: And will the gentlemen in City Hall allow what's on that wall to go against them?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: There's no need to be so cynical, Miss Aciddrop—
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: After seeing your Parkour Association president today, how can I not be?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: ...Is this really the hill you want to die on?
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: If you're going to maintain that position, I'd recommend withdrawing from the competition, so as not to make both sides look bad.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Thanks for the tip. I'll keep it in mind.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Well, that left a bad taste in my mouth...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: But are they really gonna dedicate an entire wall of City Hall for graffiti?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I won't believe it 'til I see it.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: So this is the wall, huh...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Water?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Aciddrop pokes her head out from behind the alley.
She sees that the graffiti she sprayed on the wall last night had gained a few friends, presumably added by people after her.
The policeman from last night, as well as someone she didn't recognize, are pouring water on it.
Splash.
Aciddrop rubs her eyes.
Splash.
Two buckets of cold water in, and everything she'd sprayed had become a cloud of muddy water.

The policeman takes out a colorful rag from another bucket and wipes it along the wall a couple times. The wall's original off-white color quickly reveals itself, with no trace of the graffiti left behind.
I think there's someone in the alley.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: You and your paranoia. Just hurry up and get the job done before someone sees us.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: What, change of heart? You've been fighting those filthy vandals for over a year, and now you've gone soft for 'em?
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: I was just thinking... this new material is amazing.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: Apply it to the walls in advance, and no matter what those kids spray, it's gone with just a splash of water and the wipe of a rag.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: Of course it's amazing.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: That's what progress is, Officer. Now you'll never have to chase after those little goons ever again.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: And after that association is established, they'll all come here like obedient little lapbeasts and get it out of their system. After all, who in Columbia wouldn't want the backing of the law?
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: Then all we'll have to do is check the surveillance footage every day—camera should be coming in tomorrow—and find out who's complaining about what they shouldn't be.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: Then I clean it up, and you bring the bastards in to show 'em their place.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: That way, Mr. Cooper can finally put the little troublemakers to use.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: And if anyone starts whining about their lost 'freedom,' we can just say they're giving graffiti culture a bad name and make an example of 'em. Haha! It's absolute genius!
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: Plus, the election is right around the corner. This move from Mr. Cooper is sure to garner the youth vote.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: The guy's a genius, I tell you. Keep the brats in line while also earning their loyalty!
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: A genius, huh? Yeah...
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: But what am I supposed to tell them when I bring them to the station?
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: Tell who?
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: The taggers.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: I used to lecture them about respecting other people's property.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: I'd bring them to the wall they vandalized and make them scrape it clean and paint it over. They'd learn the price of being a public nuisance through hard work and elbow grease.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: But now... how am I supposed to explain that they're being brought in for not doing 'legal graffiti'?
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: Not only that, even if it is 'legal,' there's no guarantee they won't be brought in anyway.
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: If that happens, what moral ground do I have to stand on?
attributes.name: Police Officer

attributes.content: You can stop worrying about shit like that, for starters.
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: Weren't you dead broke? If you want to change that, then shut up and do what you're told!
attributes.name: Stranger

attributes.content: Well, that was one helluva show. Good thing I dropped by.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I was hoping to grab some onion rings after the contest, but I don't know a single decent place in this town.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: And somehow I doubt I'll find one.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Still, you never know 'til you try.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: There you are, Aciddrop!
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Did someone knock on your door last night?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I knew it!
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: I was asking around earlier; some people said yes, some people said no.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Did they say why?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: They... all thought it'd be nice to do graffiti legally.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: But I don't want to be told what to do by some association, and I don't want to boss anyone else around either! Who knows what that Cooper guy is up to with these associations—
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Excuse me, but are the two of you Miss Alba and Miss Aciddrop?
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: And what if we are?!
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: I'm just here to remind you that the competition is about to start. Please head to your respective preparation areas as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Hmph. Alright then.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: One last thing, Alba—
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Excuse me, Miss Aciddrop, but we're short on time. Please head to the prep area ASAP.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: (Whispers) So you came after all.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Sure did.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: (Whispers) Can I take that as you having changed your mind?
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Well, I must admit, after you left yesterday, I mulled it over and had a change of heart.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: (Whispers) Excellent, I'm glad to hear that.
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: ...The closer we are to the home stretch, the more these finals are heating up!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Let's take a look at this contestant's creative process—hopefully we don't disturb her!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Absolutely astounding! She's using Yanese, uh, ink to create graffiti!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: (Stifles laughter)
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: How refined! It evokes Yan's classical ink figure paintings!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Excuse me, but I see you've written Mr. Cooper's name along with some Yanese characters beneath your work. Can you tell us what it says?
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Hmm, how do I put this... It means something to the effect of... eff you.
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: It's a classical Yanese swear. Haven't you ever watched any kung fu movies?
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Cut the camera! Cut the camera!
attributes.name: Staff Worker

attributes.content: Now, let's take a look at this contestant—My, oh my! This is stunning!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Those sagacious eyes, those firm lips, that resolute jawline...
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: This is, without a doubt, Mr. Cooper! A perfect portrait, no less! It's hard to imagine that this work of art was created by a simple can of spray paint!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Aciddrop, don't tell me you—
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Let go of me!
attributes.name: Alba

attributes.content: Ladies and gentlemen, as our final contestant finishes their work, we'll soon find out who'll be heading home with our generous prize—and be crowned the King of Graffiti!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: First up is this cheerful young lady's work! Your ratings, please!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Final score, 7.5!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Next up is this, uh... ink thing...
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: And to the right are some illegible scribbles... the artist signing her name?
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Final score, 1.0!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Anyone with sharp eyes would have noticed that the Yanese characters Alba wrote are missing.
But amidst the turmoil, even Alba, who was thrown out of the venue and snuck her way back in, did not realize this.
And next up is this portrait...
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Let us congratulate Miss Aciddrop, who convincingly won the graffiti contest with a perfect 10 points!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Here's your check for becoming the champion. You've earned it.
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: And now, you're welcome to give your acceptance speech!
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: Miss Aciddrop?
attributes.name: Host

attributes.content: (Sighs)
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: You gave up one of City Hall's pristine white walls for graffiti, and in the old days, I would've said that's pretty damn cool of you.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: But, this so-called contest...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: (Weighs the huge novelty check in her hands)
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: All I can say, folks, is that this is not cool.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Aciddrop suddenly tosses the check high up into the sky.

Then, while everyone is watching the huge sum of money spinning through the air, she grabs the mineral water she'd opened in advance and pours it all over the sagacious, firm, and resolute face on the wall.
Splash.
The face, like her random doodles the night before, turns into a puddle of muddy water.
The staff member in the audience immediately springs up and tries to rush onto the stage, but is tripped by a police officer in the crowd holding a rag and faceplants right into the mud.
Alright, Cooper. You won't have to wait 'til the election is over. Let me show everyone how this brand new coating works—
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Before anyone else can react, something comes flying towards the stage from the crowd, and Aciddrop jumps up to catch it firmly in her hands.
It is a tattered rag, stained by all sorts of messy colors.
She takes the rag and wipes it across the wall, suddenly revealing the original off-white color underneath.
Just a little water and a rag is enough to make anything on the wall disappear without a trace. A miracle of modern science.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: No lie, throwing a culture festival to bring in the youth vote was a pretty cool idea, Cooper. That is, if you'd really meant it.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Too bad that 'free speech' you were selling was just a fancy whiteboard, and you're more interested in using these 'legal associations' to shut us up.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: This is slander!
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: For now you're just playing games with this little wall, but soon you'll have an entire association under your thumb.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: And do you really need me to spell out what you, or some Columbian congressman, are gonna do with that?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Seize her! She's sabotaging the competition! She's inciting civil unrest! She's a domestic terrorist!
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: Several security guards step forward stiffly, clearly not expecting any of these dark undercurrents that were brewing beneath the competition.
If you'd called me a vandal, I might've even felt a little ashamed. Terrorist though? I'm down with it.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: But whatever, later y'all.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: A skateboard?!
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: Stop her this instant—
attributes.name: Representative Cooper

attributes.content: The security guards take a few symbolic steps, but in the end, nobody wants to run after something on wheels.
They can only pray that the flight of stairs in front of Aciddrop would scare her off, or at least trip her up.
But the skateboard follows her up into the air as if glued to her feet, and lands on the railing.
She then effortlessly slides down the handrails, makes a sharp turn, and disappears into the dense concrete jungle.
